channel.title: Gopher on tracker
channel.description: Recent content in Gopher on tracker

item.title: "brew install lynx", and then Gopher lives on
item.description:
Since we're reinventing the Olde Web with systems like tilde.club, here's a screen shot of the current state of Gopher.

"brew install lynx" gets a Lynx client on my Mac, and then you point lynx at gopher://gopher.floodgap.com and you're good to go.

"ssh new@sdf.org" and you can set yourself up a shell account with a gopher client installed and gopher server space available.

item.title: node-gopher, the White Mesa gopher server for node.js
item.description:
node-gopher is a little Gopher protocol server written in node.js by Robert Cunnings, NW8L. It supports an RFC 1436 Gopher server (no Gopher+) and has CGI-like support for running scripts that return Gopher pages.

Thanks to Cameron Kaiser for running the Floodgap gopher gateway that provides web access to venerable (and new) Gopherspace resources.
